intro: Seris speciosa, commonly known as the showy seris, is a striking plant native to the arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Seris speciosa is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
